channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The FBI arrested an Afghan man who officials say was planning an Election Day attack
item.description: The Justice Department said the man was inspired by the Islamic State militant organization and was plotting an Election Day attack targeting large crowds in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department said the man was inspired by the Islamic State militant organization and was plotting an Election Day attack targeting large crowds in the U.S.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Luis Tiant, charismatic Cuban who pitched the Red Sox to the brink of a title, dies at 83
item.description: The charismatic Cuban with a horseshoe mustache and mesmerizing windup pitched the Red Sox to the brink of a World Series championship and pitched himself to the doorstep of the Hall of Fame.
item.content:encoded:
The charismatic Cuban with a horseshoe mustache and mesmerizing windup pitched the Red Sox to the brink of a World Series championship and pitched himself to the doorstep of the Hall of Fame.

(Image credit: Winslow Townson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump secretly sent Putin COVID-19 tests during pandemic shortage, a new book reports
item.description: Vice President Harris is criticizing Trump over the reported shipment, which is detailed in a new book by the journalist Bob Woodward. The president's campaign has denied the reporting.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris is criticizing Trump over the reported shipment, which is detailed in a new book by the journalist Bob Woodward. The president's campaign has denied the reporting.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Jason Breslow

item.title: Lots of kids wear Crocs, but are they bad for young feet?
item.description: Crocs — those colorful clog like shoes - are popular with many kids and teens. But doctors say foot problems could be possible if they're worn constantly. Here's what to know if your kid wears Crocs.
item.content:encoded:
Crocs — those colorful clog like shoes - are popular with many kids and teens. But doctors say foot problems could be possible if they're worn constantly. Here's what to know if your kid wears Crocs.

(Image credit: sandsun)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Some Indian American Democrats see themselves in Harris. Others see the limits
item.description: In swing states like Georgia, growing numbers of South Asians could make a difference this election. So how do they feel about the woman some call "Lotus POTUS?"
item.content:encoded: In swing states like Georgia, growing numbers of South Asians could make a difference this election. So how do they feel about the woman some call "Lotus POTUS?"
item.dc:creator: Sandhya Dirks

item.title: Musk's X to be reinstated in Brazil after complying with Supreme Court demands
item.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice authorized the restoration of the social media platform's service in Brazil, over a month after its nationwide shutdown, according to a court document.
item.content:encoded:
A Brazilian Supreme Court justice authorized the restoration of the social media platform's service in Brazil, over a month after its nationwide shutdown, according to a court document.

(Image credit: Eraldo Peres)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Supreme Court majority may embrace ATF's ghost gun rule
item.description: The ATF classifies the kits as firearms under the 1968 Gun Control Act, but kit manufacturers and sellers challenged the rule in court, asserting that the ATF had exceeded its authority.
item.content:encoded:
The ATF classifies the kits as firearms under the 1968 Gun Control Act, but kit manufacturers and sellers challenged the rule in court, asserting that the ATF had exceeded its authority.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Azerbaijan’s human-rights record is under fire as it prepares to host UN climate talks
item.description: Azerbaijan has carried out an “escalating crackdown” on government critics and activists over the past two years, according to Human Rights Watch and Freedom Now.
item.content:encoded:
Azerbaijan has carried out an “escalating crackdown” on government critics and activists over the past two years, according to Human Rights Watch and Freedom Now.

(Image credit: Tofik Babayev)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Two Jewish Democrats reflect on Congressional efforts to combat surge in antisemitism
item.description: On the anniversary of Hamas’ attacks on Israel, Jewish lawmakers reflect on what role Congress can play in addressing rising antisemitism in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
On the anniversary of Hamas’ attacks on Israel, Jewish lawmakers reflect on what role Congress can play in addressing rising antisemitism in the U.S.

(Image credit: Stefan Jeremiah)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Hurricane preparedness: Expert guidance on flooding, power outages and more
item.description: The Atlantic hurricane season isn't over yet. Get ahead of the next storm with these emergency preparedness tips to protect you, your family and your home.
item.content:encoded:
The Atlantic hurricane season isn't over yet. Get ahead of the next storm with these emergency preparedness tips to protect you, your family and your home.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Life Kit
